name: sync::mpmc::context::Context::reset

core::convert::Into::into.doc: Converts this type into the (usually inferred) input type.

core::sync::atomic::AtomicUsize::store.doc:
Stores a value into the atomic integer.

 `store` takes an [`Ordering`] argument which describes the memory ordering of this operation.
  Possible values are [`SeqCst`], [`Release`] and [`Relaxed`].

 # Panics

 Panics if `order` is [`Acquire`] or [`AcqRel`].

 # Examples

 ```


 some_var.store(10, Ordering::Relaxed);
 assert_eq!(some_var.load(Ordering::Relaxed), 10);
 ```

core::ptr::null_mut.doc:
Creates a null mutable raw pointer.

 This function is equivalent to zero-initializing the pointer:
 `MaybeUninit::<*mut T>::zeroed().assume_init()`.
 The resulting pointer has the address 0.

 # Examples

 ```
 use std::ptr;

 let p: *mut i32 = ptr::null_mut();
 assert!(p.is_null());
 assert_eq!(p as usize, 0); // this pointer has the address 0
 ```
